intro: Leucas nyassae var. nyassae, commonly known as African buttonweed, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, round, seed-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
